intro: Mosla chinensis, commonly known as Chinese mosla, is a perennial herb native to East Asia. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which includes many aromatic plants such as mint and sage. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring square stems and opposite leaves with a slightly hairy surface. Its small, clustered flowers are usually pink or purple, blooming in late spring to early summer. The leaves and flowers are often used in traditional Chinese medicine for their purported health benefits.
